intro: Bupleurum chinense f. chiliosciadium, commonly known as the Chinese thorned bugloss, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. This variety is often cultivated for its medicinal properties and ornamental value in gardens.
